questions.question: The root locus technique is most applicable to:
In the root locus plot, stable regions are represented by poles located in:

answers.a: The right-half of the complex plane
answers.b: The left-half of the complex plane
answers.c: The upper half of the complex plane
answers.d: The lower half of the complex plane

answers.a: The magnitude response of a system
answers.b: The phase response of a system
answers.c: The locations of the system's poles as K varies
answers.d: The locations of the system's zeros as K varies

questions.question: Which of the following statements about root locus is true?

answers.a: The root locus plot always starts at the origin
answers.b: The root locus plot is symmetric with respect to the real axis
answers.c: The root locus plot represents the locations of the system's zeros
answers.d: The root locus plot is not influenced by the values of the system's poles

questions.question: What is the number of the root locus segments which do not terminate on zeroes?

answers.c: The difference between the number of poles and zeroes
answers.d: The sum of the number of poles and the number of the zeroes
